Compute adjusted significance cutoff for multiple testing correction

adjusted_cutoff.Rd

This function computes the adjusted significance level (cutoff) for multiple hypothesis testing using either Benjamini-Hochberg (BH) or Bonferroni correction, accounting for quality control failures.

Usage

adjusted_cutoff(
  mean_list,
  sd_list,
  multiple_testing_alpha,
  multiple_testing_method,
  side,
  QC_prob
)

Arguments

mean_list

Numeric vector. Mean values of test statistics for each hypothesis.

sd_list

Numeric vector. Standard deviation values of test statistics for each hypothesis.

multiple_testing_alpha

Numeric. Target false discovery rate or family-wise error rate.

multiple_testing_method

Character. Multiple testing method, either "BH" or "bonferroni".

side

Character. Test sidedness: "left", "right", or "both".

QC_prob

Numeric vector. The probability of failing QC for each hypothesis.

Value

Numeric. The adjusted significance level (cutoff threshold).

Details

The function implements:

  • BH method: Uses bisection search to find the appropriate cutoff that controls the false discovery rate at the specified level

  • Bonferroni method: Divides the target alpha by the effective number of tests (accounting for QC failures)

See also

BH_cutoff_bisection for the BH-specific implementation compute_power_posthoc for the main power analysis function
